bug.short_desc: Provide util methods to find an item by path

long_desc.thetext:
In general a developer needs a method to get an item form a tree structure models by passing a path as identifier
For example: my.util.getItemByPath(ancestor, path, childProperty, labelPath)
- ancestor is the start point for the path normally the root node. - path a string like "/test1/test1.1/test1.1.1/element" - childProperty is the identifier to find the childrens - labelPath is the identifier to compare it with the path

Important to notice is that the path should not be a path like we know if from the data binding. Its a path containing strings which identify a model object by its name like an id or name. Thats why a childProperty is needed to to through the chain. The labelPath here is the property where this identifier could be found.
